get.description: Retrieve details of a particular account using its ID as a reference

put.description: Edit details of a particular account using its ID as a reference

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of Account to be edited

get.summary: Get all Notifications for a Customer
get.description: Retrieve details of all notifications set up for a customer using the customer's ID as a reference

post.summary: Set up a Notification for a Customer
post.description: Sets up a new notification for a customer using the customer's ID as a reference. Returns a notification ID that should be saved if the notification needs to be amended in the future
Endpoint to mock the credit of an account

parameters.name: creditRequest
parameters.description: Details of credit to the account

get.summary: Check if a particular webhook has failed
get.description: For some reason we decided to keep our old format for this endpoint and instead of using 'notifications' you need to use 'webhooks', request a specific webhook ID and specify you want to see failures. (Max 50)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Failed since Date. Needs to be urlEncoded value

get.description: The ability to get the details of beneficiaries using various pieces of information, e.g. using Customer ID, retrieve all beneficiaries created by that customer. Can get details of one particular beneficiary based on the unique beneficiary reference number.

The ability to get the details of payments using various pieces of information, e.g. using Account ID, retrieve all payments in that account. Can get details of one particular payment based on the unique payment reference number.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Payment id. If specified then all other parameters are ignored

parameters.name: fromCreatedDate
parameters.description: Payments created date equal or after to this date. Mandatory Parameter(except when 'id' parameter is used)

parameters.name: toCreatedDate
parameters.description: Payments created date equal or before to this date

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Payment status, multiple statuses can be specified by repeating the parameter

post.description: Supports both Payments to external bank accounts via Faster Payments and transfers to other Modulr accounts. Requests to Payments are asynchronous.

get.summary: Get all Rules for a specific Account
get.description: The ability to get the details of all rules associated with the specified account using the Account ID as a reference. Can filter by a specific type using the type parameter.

parameters.name: aid
parameters.description: Id of Account to get Rules of

get.description: Either using unique references, such as Customer ID, or filter parameters, such as verification status, get details of any Customers found.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Id or name or external reference of customer to search for

parameters.name: fromCreatedDate
parameters.description: Customers created after and on this date

parameters.name: toCreatedDate
parameters.description: Customers created before and on this date

post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new customer. The Customer object is quite large as a lot of information is needed to create one, including any people assosiated with the Customer such as directors (this changes depending on the type of legal entity the company is). Although the object is named 'Company' an individual can also be created.

put.description: The ability to modify the details of a specific rule based on the rule's unique reference.

parameters.name: rid
parameters.description: Id of Rule to be edited

get.description: Get details of accounts belonging to a particular customer using the customer’s ID as a reference

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: Id of Customer to fetch Accounts for

parameters.name: minBalance
parameters.description: Accounts with balance equal or more than this amount

parameters.name: maxBalance
parameters.description: Accounts with balance equal or less than this amount

parameters.name: fromCreatedDate
parameters.description: Accounts created after and on this date

parameters.name: toCreatedDate
parameters.description: Accounts created before and on this date

post.description: Creates an account for a particular customer using the customer’s ID as a reference

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: Id of Customer to create account for

get.summary: Retrieve a specific Customer using a unique Customer reference
get.description: Either using unique references, such as Customer ID, or filter parameters, such as verification status, get details of any Customers found.

put.summary: Edit a specific Customer using a unique Customer reference
put.description: Using the unique references (Customer ID), you are able to change the alias of the Customer.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: Id of Customer to be edited

get.summary: Retrieve details of a Batch Payment
get.description: As well as supporting individual payment requests, the Modulr payment platform can also handle multiple payment objects in the same request. This endpoint is to get the details of a batch payment that has already been created, via the unique reference that was in the response to the original batch payment request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id given when batch request was made

post.summary: Create a new Beneficiary for a specified Customer
post.description: The ability to create a new beneficiary for a Customer, using their Customer ID as a reference.

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: Id of Customer to create Beneficiary for

delete.summary: Delete Beneficiaries for a specified Customer
delete.description: Deleting beneficiaries for a Customer, using their customer ID

parameters.name: cid
parameters.description: Id of Customer to delete Beneficiaries for

parameters.name: bid
parameters.description: Id(s) of Beneficiaries to delete, must owned by customer and active

207.description: Map of multiple responses for multi-request

post.description: As well as supporting individual payment requests, the Modulr payment platform can also handle multiple payment objects in the same request. This endpoint allows you to make a new batch payment.
When you no longer want or need an account you are able to close using the Account ID as a unique reference
When you want a new rule on an account you can create one with this endpoint. Note that Rules are linked to an Account and each Account can only have one instance of a Rule type

delete.description: When you no longer want a rule on an account you can do it with this endpoint. You can delete more than one rule in the same request.

207.description: Map of multiple responses for multi-request

get.summary: Retrieve a specific notification by unique reference for a specific customer
get.description: This allows you to see the settings for a particular notification that has been set up, for example if you want to check if it is active or the emails the notification is being sent to. It would be best practice to call this before updating a notification.

put.summary: Update a specific notification by unique reference for a specific customer
put.description: If you need to change anything about a particular notification, for example add an email address or make it inactive, then this is the endpoint to use. You need to put all of the information into this request for the notification even if it isn't changing, so either you will need to record this somewhere when you create the notification, or call the 'GET' request first.

get.description: Gives the ability to find accounts and get their details using filters

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Id or Name of Account to search for

parameters.name: minBalance
parameters.description: Accounts with balance equal or more than this amount

parameters.name: maxBalance
parameters.description: Accounts with balance equal or less than this amount

parameters.name: fromCreatedDate
parameters.description: Accounts created after and on this date

parameters.name: toCreatedDate
parameters.description: Accounts created before and on this date

get.summary: Retrieve a Rule by rule type on a specific account
get.description: You need to know the unique reference of the account and the rule type you want to get to information on

parameters.name: aid
parameters.description: Id of Account to get Rule of

get.summary: Get Transactions for a specific Account
get.description: Retrieves the last 6 months of transactions (successful payments in & out) of an account, specified by a unique account reference.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of Account to fetch Transactions for

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Partial description text to search for

parameters.name: minAmount
parameters.description: Transactions with amount equal or more than this amount

parameters.name: maxAmount
parameters.description: Transactions with amount equal or less than this amount

parameters.name: fromTransactionDate
parameters.description: Transactions with transaction date equal or after to this date

parameters.name: toTransactionDate
parameters.description: Transactions with transaction date equal or before to this date

parameters.name: fromPostedDate
parameters.description: Transactions with posted date equal or after to this date

parameters.name: toPostedDate
parameters.description: Transactions with posted date equal or before to this date

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Transactions of this type, multiple types can be specified by repeating the parameter

parameters.name: credit
parameters.description: If true only credit transactions will be returned, if false, only debit transactions will be returned

balance.description: Balance of the account in format 'NN.NN'

createdDate.description: Datetime when the account was created

currency.description: Currency of the account in ISO 4217 format

status.description: Status of the account. Accounts must be 'ACTIVE' to make and receive payments. Can be one of

associates.description: Array of associate objects that link to the Customer. For example, this could contain the details of the company directors for a Limited company, or or the partners for a partnership.

companyRegNumber.description: The company registration / incorporation number of the company. Only applicable for companies registered with Companies House

createdDate.description: Datetime when the customer was created

documentInfo.description: Array of document objects that relate to the Customer being created. Examples of Documents could be proof of a Company Director's identity or address, Articles of Association or a Partnership Agreement.

expectedMonthlySpend.description: Indication of the monthly spend of the customer.

id.description: Unique identifier for a Customer. Begins with 'C'

name.description: Customer's company name - must be unique across the Modulr platform.

registeredAddress.description: The address of the company's registered office.

status.description: Status of the Customer. Customers must be 'Active' for Accounts to be created for them. Can be:

tcsVersion.description: Version of the Modulr Account Terms and Conditions the Customer has agreed to.

tradingAddress.description: The address of the company's day-to-day trading activities.

type.description: The type of Customer - accepted values are:

verificationStatus.description: How the identity of the Customer has been verified. Can be:

content.description: List of responses on the current page

page.description: Current page number. Its 0 based. i.e firstpage =0, secondpage=1

content.description: List of responses on the current page

page.description: Current page number. Its 0 based. i.e firstpage =0, secondpage=1

applicant.description: Indciates if the associate is the applicant. Only one associate should be marked as such

dateOfBirth.description: Date in yyyy-MM-dd format. Valid age is from 18 to 100 years

industryCode.description: Mandatory for all types except for 'INDIVIDUAL'

tradingAddress.description: Trading address. Mandatory for all types except for 'INDIVIDUAL'

name.description: AlphaNumeric characters plus [ _ ' @ , & £ $ € ¥ = # % ‘ ’ : ; \ / < > « »  ! ‘ “ ” . ? - *{ }  + % ( )]. Mandatory for all types except 'INDIVIDUAL'

companyRegNumber.description: 8 digits or 2 alphabets followed by 6 digits, must be specified if the type is limited company

productCode.description: Product associated with the account. Contact your account manager for correct code to use.

additionalInfo.description: any extra information available on transaction.

amount.description: Amount of the transaction in Major Currency Units

credit.description: Indicates if the transaction was a Credit or a Debit

currency.description: Currency of the account in ISO 4217 format

description.description: Description of the transaction. Contains Payer/ Payee details and reference

postedDate.description: Datetime when the transaction was posted to the Modulr system.

transactionDate.description: Datetime when the transaction took place

type.description: Enumerated type indicating the type of the transaction. Values:

content.description: List of responses on the current page

page.description: Current page number. Its 0 based. i.e firstpage =0, secondpage=1

content.description: List of responses on the current page

page.description: Current page number. Its 0 based. i.e firstpage =0, secondpage=1

applicant.description: Indicates which Associate originally applied for the Modulr account

dateOfBirth.description: Associate's date of birth in format yyyy-MM-dd

documentInfo.description: Documents gathered during Customer Due Dilligence checks on an Associate.

ownership.description: The Associates's percentage ownership of the Customer

type.description: Describes the relation between the Associate and the Customer. Can be one of

verificationStatus.description: How the Associate was verified. Can be one of

accountId.description: Id of the account if this beneficiary is a Modulr account, null otherwise

approvalRequired.description: Indicates if the beneficiary creation is pending approval

customerId.description: Id of the customer than owns this beneficiary

defaultReference.description: Default reference used for payments to the Beneficiary.

externalReference.description: External system reference for the Beneficiary

id.description: Unique reference for the Beneficiary. Begins with 'B'

status.description: Status of the Beneficiary. Can be:

amount.description: Amount of the payment in Major Current Units - '1' = 1.00 GBP

reference.description: Reference to be used for the Payment. This will appear on the Account statement/the recipient's bank account. Min 6 to max 18 characters. Can contain alphanumeric, '-', '.', '&', '/' and space.

accountNumber.description: Account Number of destination account if using SCAN type.

id.description: Identifier for the Payment destination if using ACCOUNT or BENEFICIARY type. Can be either: a) Beneficiary id for an external Payment, b) Account id for a transfer to another Account

name.description: Name for new destination beneficiary if one is created.

sortCode.description: Sort Code of destination account if using SCAN type.

type.description: Indicates the type of destination. Can be one of

status.description: Current status of batch. Can be one of

content.description: List of responses on the current page

page.description: Current page number. Its 0 based. i.e firstpage =0, secondpage=1

approvalStatus.description: Current approval status of payment. Can be one of

status.description: Current status of payment. Can be one of

details.description: All the details of the payment from the original request

id.description: Unique id for the Payment request

externalReference.description: Your reference for this Batch of payments

payments.description: Lists of payments. Need atleast 1 and maximum of 1000

strictProcessing.description: Flag to control if the entire batch fails for any individual payment validation failure

accountId.description: The Account which the Rule is created on.

customerId.description: The Customer which the Rule is created on.

data.description: Complex object that describes the Rule. For Split Type, this is an array of splits, with each split having percent & destinationId. Sweep Type, this needs frequency & destinationId.

customerId.description: The Customer which the Rule is created on.

type.description: The type of Rule.Can be one of

config.description: Configuration information for this Notification entity.

destinations.description: The list of emails or webhooks used for sending the notification.

status.description: Status of the notification.  Can be one of

channel.description: Channel used to send the notification.

config.description: Configuration information for this Notification entity.

customerId.description: Unique Identifier for the customer of this notification.

destinations.description: A list of emails or webhooks used to send the notification.

type.description: Type of notification. Can be one of

daysToRun.description: Days of the week when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

retry.description: Flag indicating whether failed webhooks should be retried. This attribute applies only to 'WEBHOOK' notifications channel.

secret.description: Mandatory for webhook. Secret that is used in HMAC calculation, for webhooks. This attribute applies only to 'WEBHOOK' notifications channel.

threshold.description: Amount threshold which triggers the notification. This attribute only applies to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'PAYIN', 'PAYOUT'.

timesToRun.description: Times of the day when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

customerBid.description: Unique Identifier for the customer of this webhook.

eventName.description: Event which would trigger the webhook. Can be one of

url.description: Endpoint URL for receiving webhook data

channel.description: Channel used for sending the notification.  Can be one of

config.description: Configuration information for this Notification entity.

destinations.description: The list of emails or url(webhook) used for sending the notification. For 'EMAIL' channel this can be a list of comma separated email addresses. For 'WEBHOOK' channel this should be a single URL.

type.description: Type of the notification. Can be one of

amount.description: Amount of the payment in major current Units - '1' = 1.00 GBP

numberOfTransactions.description: Number of credit transactions to create, defaults to 1

transactionDate.description: Date of credit in yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ format

accountNumber.description: AccountNo (8 digits) of payer. Required if type is SCAN

sortCode.description: SortCode(6 digits) of payer. Required if type is SCAN
